data.title: Omaha Police Department
data.meta_description: This is the official web site of the Omaha Police Department located in Omaha, Nebraska.
data.text:
Cold Cases

Search

Victim's Race

Victim's Date of Birth

View Solved Cases

Total 50 result(s) found.

Andrea Georgeson

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 10/23/2019 04:26 AM

Case #: AP00440

Location: 711 N 108th Ct.

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Andrea Georgeson was working her first overnight shift at her second job when she was murdered. She was savagely ripped from our lives, leaving a hole in our hearts. Please help us find closure for our beloved daughter, sister, and aunt.

Antonio M. Simonds

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 08/26/2007 12:17 AM

Case #: N57609

Location: 5430 N 42 Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Antonio or Montez as his family called him, was a family oriented man. He had some bumps in the road but was able to turn his life around. He started working full-time, got an apartment and focused on his 2 kids. He moved back in with his mom and dad in the summer of 2007 to start studying to become a truck driver. He was taken away from his family before he could start. We miss his smile, the laughter and his loving heart everyday.

Antonio Taliaferro

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 06/01/1998 04:15 AM

Case #: P83781

Location: 5310 South 30th Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Antonio S. Taliaferro was a loving son, brother, nephew, cousin and friend that loved to play basketball. His beautiful eyes and smile was everything to his mother. He is truly missed and will live forever through everyone that he loved and loved him.

Barry Averett III

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 08/15/2012 12:33 PM

Case #: Q12606

Location: 39th and Burdette Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Barry Dewayne Averett was a kind and loving person. He made mistakes in his life just like everybody else. No person in this world is without sin. We love him and miss him dearly and would like closure in the homicide of his tragic death.

Brandin Princole

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 10/12/2012 02:40 PM

Case #: Q27528

Location: 46th and Larimore Avenue

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Brandin Princole was a wonderful son, brother, and uncle. He was a wonderful, amazing person to all of his family and friends who loved him with all of their hearts. Taken too soon, gone but not forgotten. I will miss you and love you always and forever. - Brandin's mother

Brandon Thomas

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 09/05/2012 04:42 PM

Case #: Q18181

Location: 41st and Maple Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Brandon Thomas was a very happy person who everyone loved. He was father to a beautiful boy that he was taken from too soon.

Charles Toles

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 12/13/2019 10:45 PM

Case #: AP14395

Location: 18th Street / Emmett Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Charles Toles was a family oriented man who always looked out for his mother and children (whether or not they were his own). He’d just started college, wanting to become a counselor to help troubled youth. He was a comedian in his own right, always making people laugh. He left behind two daughters.

Cornail Hill Jr.

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 06/10/2021 02:19 AM

Case #: AR34247

Location: 5720 N 33rd Avenue

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Cornail Hill Jr. was taken from his family at the tender age of 15. He was walking home from a friend's house and never made it to see his family. Cornail, also known as LC, was loved by many. He was an exceptional athlete, son, brother, grandson, nephew and uncle. Wish he was here with US.

Cornelius C. Hodges

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 10/30/2016 07:02 PM

Case #: AJ19743

Location: 3009 Hamilton Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Please, if anyone knows anything about my dear, beloved son Cornelius Hodges, come forward and contact OPD with any information you may have. I gratefully appreciate it! Cornelius was an angel. I don't know who would want to harm a person that don't bother anyone. There's a hole in my soul that will never be right. I've lost both my boys and have no closure. Please, if anyone has any information call OPD.

Thanks again, his mother - Diane Hodges- Perry - God Bless

Damon Jackson

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 10/21/2017 02:36 AM

Case #: AK09588

Location: 4117 North 26th Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

The loss of Damon G. Jackson, a loving son, brother, uncle, nephew, cousin and friend, has put a void in the hearts of everyone that loves him. The life & legacy of Damon G. Jackson will live through his family & friends.

David Cooper / Kevin Pace

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 09/10/2015 07:06 PM

Case #: AH18913

Location: 4111 Miami Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Kevin Pace was loving, caring and generous. His family thanks God for him.

Deroshia Matthews / Kamal Matthews

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 04/24/1979 12:00 AM

Case #: M36677

Location: 4264 Binney Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Deroshia Matthews was a former teacher's aide and crossing guard at Clifton Hill School. Ms. Matthews was formerly from Jackson, MS where she studied music and psychology at Jackson State University. She worked in tutoring and recreation programs. Ms. Matthews taught music lessons and worked for a time at Omaha Girl's Club

Her son Kamal Matthews was a second-grader at Clifton Hill School. Kamal liked to ride his bike and read comics. Together they had a Omaha World-Herald paper-route.

Devon Brown

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 04/26/2010 09:58 PM

Case #: Y09449

Location: 6341 N24th Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Devon Brown was the light of his family, the one nobody could stay mad around, no matter the situation. He always knew how to make everyone happy.

Edward Reed III

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 08/19/2016 10:45 AM

Case #: AJ01262

Location: 3030 Y Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Edward Shannon Reed III was a beautiful son, father, brother, and uncle that was always there not only for his family, but friends. He is still greatly missed.

Elijah Jackson

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 06/02/2008 06:26 PM

Case #: V32383

Location: 62nd and Ames Avenue

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Elijah Jackson was a loving son, father, brother, and uncle! He always enjoyed family, football, and having a good time, but most of all, he was his mother's best friend! He's gone but never forgotten!

Gary Lesac

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 03/18/1994 06:24 AM

Case #: J72857

Location: 32nd and Upland Parkway

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Although Gary Lesac's life was cut short, one of his gifts was his ability to relate to animals. He also enjoyed nature, being outdoors and fishing.

Gilberto Hernandez-Vazquez

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 08/23/2012 08:22 PM

Case #: Q14907

Location: 19th and Y Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

On Thursday, August 23, 2012, Gilberto Hernandez-Vazquez was in the area of 19th and Y Street selling ice cream from his ice cream stand when he was shot. Omaha Police Officers were dispatched to the area at 8:22 p.m. in reference to a shooting and located Gilberto down in the middle of the street being attended to by OFD personnel. Gilberto was transported to a local hospital where he was pronounced deceased.

Irvin Settje Jr.

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 04/22/1988 12:17 AM

Case #: A46921

Location: 4709 Hamilton Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

My oldest brother was forcibly taken from his family in April 1988. That devastated my parents. He was my mom's best friend and took her everywhere. I personally had to take care of the funeral arrangements.

Jakela Foster / Latecia Fox / Cameron Harris

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 01/24/2015 01:44 AM

Case #: O58587

Location: 34th and Parker Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Jakela Foster was a beautiful devoted mother, daughter, granddaughter, sister, aunt, niece, cousin and friend who loved to live life and laugh. Jakela's laughter will forever be missed and her love will forever be felt.

Latecia Fox was a loving daughter, sister, niece, cousin and friend that was full of love, life and laughter. "Tish" had a heart of gold and the spirit of a warrior. Her love and laughter will forever be remembered.

Cameron Harris was a loving son, nephew, cousin and uncle. Not only was he loved by family, he was loved by his community. He would often help around his neighborhood where he grew up in southside terrace. All the kids loved him and he did a lot for them. For Christmas he would buy all the kids in the family gifts. Though he didn't get a chance to have any of his own, you couldn't tell. People would come to him for advice. He was very well respected and people trusted him. He didn't have any enemies. If you were to ask about him, they would say all positive things. Even seven years later his name still lives on through people and he inspired many. Some would even call him a legend and he will forever live on through us!

Jameila Hesseltine / Carl Reed

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 09/12/2011 09:10 AM

Case #: Z30618

Location: 4439 Commercial Avenue #3

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Jameila Hesseltine was a beautiful loyal mother, daughter, granddaughter, sister, aunt, niece, cousin and friend that devoted her life to her two boys and her love to anyone who loved her. She loved living life, laughing at every moment and loving at every opportunity.

James Moss Jr.

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 10/19/2012 02:31 PM

Case #: Q29287

Location: 1826 Manderson Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

James Moss Jr. was a loyal son, father, brother, uncle, nephew, cousin and friend that loved hard and was loyal to those loyal to him. He will live forever through all that love him.

Janee Hadan

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 12/15/2013 01:49 AM

Case #: I65622

Location: 108th and Q Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Janee Hadan was a beautiful, full of life, loving mother, daughter, sister, aunt, granddaughter, niece, cousin and friend with a heart of gold; she will live forever through those who love her.

Jasmine Harris

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 06/02/2018 11:44 PM

Case #: AK66857

Location: near 11th and Farnam Street.

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Jasmine Harris was a beautiful daughter, sister, aunt, niece, cousin and friend that loved to laugh and live life. Jasmine was a beautiful free spirit that had so much more life to live; may she forever live in the hearts of all that love her.

Jefferey Snoddy

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 03/29/2008 06:18 AM

Case #: V14609

Location: 2414 Himebaugh Avenue

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

It's Been Over 15 Long Devastating Years Since My Son Was Murdered. It Seems As Though It Was Just Yesterday That He Was Stolen From Us. This Pain In My Heart Is Very Excruciating, Especially Since There Has Been No Justice. I'm Still Wondering Every Single Day Who Did This And Why... My Life Hasn't Been The Same Since. We Need Closure..... Not Knowing Who Murdered My Son Is A Pain It's Self.

Jeffrey Moore

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 05/01/2008 10:43 AM

Case #: V23847

Location: 6404 N 132nd Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

May1, 2008...

Gone but not forgotten...

Loving father/grandson you're truly missed.

John Gerber

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 12/08/2009 01:03 PM

Case #: X77550

Location: 7166 N 30th Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

John Gerber was a beloved father to five children and uncle to nine nieces and nephews. He was a open and caring person, who accepted everyone at face value with no judgement. He was taken too early from his family and friends. The loss is still very painful without any kind of closure.

JohnTavious Swift

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 09/24/2014 03:28 PM

Case #: O30348

Location: 36th and Forest Lawn Avenue

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

JohnTavious Swift got off a school bus in the area of 36th and Forest Lawn Avenue Wednesday, September 24, 2014 to walk home after school. A vehicle drove up and a suspect got out of the vehicle and fired several shots at JohnTavious. At 3:28 p.m., Omaha Police officers were dispatched to the area regarding a shooting. Officers locate JohnTavious in the area suffering from a gunshot wound. Medics on scene transport JohnTavious to a local hospital with CPR in progress. JohnTavious later died from his injuries.

Anyone with information, please call or message the Omaha Police Cold Case Homicide Unit at 402-444-5656 or opdcoldcase@cityofomaha.org . Those who wish to remain anonymous and be eligible for the $25,000 reward must contact Omaha Crime Stoppers directly at (402) 444-STOP or through the P3 Tips mobile app. Additional information on Omaha Crime Stoppers available on www.omahacrimestoppers.org .

Johnton Banks

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 12/27/2019 07:31 PM

Case #: AP17956

Location: 3025 Stone Ave.

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Johnton Banks was a very special son, brother, uncle and father that was truly loved and will be missed greatly.

Kenvaughn Glass

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 11/30/2019 12:32 AM

Case #: AP10669

Location: N 24th / Vane Streets

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Kenvaughn Shakur Glass is one of six children. Family was very important to Kenvaughn. He loved sports, was an excellent athlete, and a good sportsman. It’s been four long, miserable years without Kenvaughn. Kenvaughn is very loved and missed. Please let’s get some justice for my grandson, son, nephew, uncle, cousin, and friend.

Kevon Green

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 07/20/2020 05:47 PM

Case #: AP63188

Location: 30th and Sorensen Parkway

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Kevon Green was a loving son, brother, grandson, nephew, cousin and friend, who was loved by many. He was a quiet, humble soul with a big heart and beautiful smile. Kevon had such a bright future and was taken from us way too soon...but never forgotten. He is truly missed by all who love him. Kevon will forever be in our hearts.

LaDontae Daugherty

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 08/16/2014 02:22 AM

Case #: O20821

Location: 37th and Bedford Avenue

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

LaDontae Daugherty was a loving and loyal father, son, brother, uncle, nephew, cousin and friend that lived for his family and loved to laugh. He will live forever through his family and friends.

Lamond Strong

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 11/01/2016 04:39 AM

Case #: AJ20122

Location: 5701 South 29th Avenue

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Lamond Strong was a loyal son, father, brother, uncle, nephew, cousin and friend. Lamond loved to laugh, making everyone around him laugh. May his laughter forever be remembered.

Laura J. Linehan

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 12/13/1979 09:43 PM

Case #: M88921

Location: 2804 Larimore Ave

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

She was a great mom. She loved everyone and would do anything for anybody. She was very outdoorsy, helped her community and always made people laugh. She is truly missed and loved every second of the day.

Levi Brown

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 05/20/2013 09:51 PM

Case #: Q78136

Location: 4921 North 60th Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Levi Brown was a loving son, father, brother, uncle, nephew, cousin and friend that lived a life of love and laughter. He is missed with every breath.

Markell Brewer

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 09/04/2016 12:22 AM

Case #: AJ05156

Location: 31 / Decatur Streets

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Markell was a very hard worker with an outgoing personality. He was also a very generous and loyal person. Whenever you saw him he had the biggest, beautiful smile on his face. His life was cut short on September 4, 2016 on his night off from work as he stood in front of his grandmother's house. Let's not just get justice for Markell, but also for the only daughter he left behind, Mya Markell.

Markquis Walker

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 09/05/2014 10:23 AM

Case #: O25672

Location: N 24th St/Pratt St

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

God 1st, his daughter 2nd, his family 3rd in that order. We all need justice from this senseless crime. Markquis Walker AKA Kuis Antone didn't deserve what happened to him.

MarRico Gafford Sr.

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 01/08/2002 09:50 PM

Case #: U49428

Location: 3343 Larimore Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

MarRico Gafford (A.K.A.) “PUNKEN” was the nickname given to him when he was a little boy from our beloved mother. He was a very intelligent and handsome young man with a heart of gold. He genuinely loved his family, people, and they loved him too. He was an excellent father and provider. He loved spending quality time with his children. He loved sports - especially basketball, his basketball shoes, classic cars, and playing electronic games. The family is still praying and asking if someone knows something to please come forward.

Mercedes De Leon Cayaxon

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 10/27/2020 09:54 PM

Case #: AP86428

Location: 11255 Evans Street #10

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Mercedes De Leon Cayaxon was a hard working single mother who was working to support her children in Guatemala. Mercedes loved her children dearly. She enjoyed cooking healthy foods.

Michael Rowell

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 08/08/2019 11:44 PM

Case #: AL79345

Location: 6212 Maple Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

On Thursday, August 8, 2019 at 11:44 p.m., officers with the Omaha Police Department were dispatched to 6212 Maple Street, mid-town Benson area, regarding a shooting. Upon arrival, officers along with OFD located Michael Rowell down in the parking lot suffering from multiple gunshot wounds. Michael was pronounced deceased at the scene.

Anyone with information, please call or message the Omaha Police Cold Case Homicide Unit at 402-444-5656 or opdcoldcase@cityofomaha.org . Those who wish to remain anonymous and be eligible for the $25,000 reward must contact Omaha Crime Stoppers directly at (402) 444-STOP or through the P3 Tips mobile app. Additional information on Omaha Crime Stoppers available on www.omahacrimestoppers.org .

Mickle Graham

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 12/18/2010 10:59 PM

Case #: Y66389

Location: 4143 N. 44th Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Mickle always had a smile on his face and would try to make others smile. He had a warm personality and many friends. Mickle was always there for his family, He was a beloved son, father, brother and uncle. "Gone but forever loved."

Paige Miller / Michael Anderson

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 07/22/2010 04:00 AM

Case #: Y29731

Location: 10th & Bert Murphy Avenue

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

On Thursday, July 22, 2010 at 4:00 a.m., officers with the Omaha Police Department were flagged down regarding two unresponsive parties lying in the grass near 10th Street & Bert Murphy Avenue (Henry Doorly Zoo). Officers located Paige Miller and Michael Anderson down and both suffering from multiple gunshot wounds. Both Paige and Michael were declared deceased at the scene.

Anyone with information, please call or message the Omaha Police Cold Case Homicide Unit at 402-444-5656 or opdcoldcase@cityofomaha.org . Those who wish to remain anonymous and be eligible for the $25,000 reward must contact Omaha Crime Stoppers directly at (402) 444-STOP or through the P3 Tips mobile app. Additional information on Omaha Crime Stoppers available on www.omahacrimestoppers.org .

Percy Walker

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 03/30/2008 01:20 PM

Case #: V14952

Location: 2608 Camden Avenue

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

March 20th, 2023 is the 15 year anniversary of the loss of our beloved Percy Walker. Percy was truly a gift that was taken away before he had the chance to blossom. They say time heals all wounds but our wounds are still bleeding. Our family has yet to receive the justice and closure we deserve.

Death is inevitable but Percy didn't just die, He was murdered. Murdered for trying to keep the peace and break up a fight that wasn't his own. He was taken away from family and friends who loved him and who needed him. A mother is without her child, children are without their father, and siblings are without their brother.

Percy was art. He loved to write music and dance. He had goals that were bigger than Omaha but he never had a chance to see them through. Each day and with each breath that he took his heart would pump out a new tune. He danced like no one was watching and he would get lost in the world of his art because that was his escape. On March 30th, 2008 the music stopped. The song ended and the dream died. Percy left us. He left his mark on his community but also left the people who love him to grieve. Although he’s no longer here, his song and memory lives on forever.

There is a code in the streets that sadly people still live by. A code where people would rather protect a murderer than give a grieving family closure. There's also something called "Linked Fate." Linked Fate is where you see yourself or your loved ones in the place of the victim. Well I'm asking that you all have linked fate today. Think about what you would want if it were your family or someone that you loved. Help us bring Percy justice. If anyone has any information please come forward.

Terry Kelley

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 05/19/2016 04:47 AM

Case #: AH78401

Location: 5109 North 46th Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Terry Kelley was a boisterous teddy bear who cared deeply for his family and would give his last penny to a friend in need. He admittedly made some bad choices throughout his life but was moving toward a positive future when someone took all hope of that away. Please help us find the person who did this.

Valencia Hogan-Pierce

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 08/04/2012 01:01 AM

Case #: Q10042

Location: N 16th and Willis Avenue

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Valencia will always be remembered for her warming, contagious smile, and her heart was as big as her smile. She lived to help people even in death. Her soul was quiet and gentle and her untimely demise was not deserving. Hopefully her killer(s) will be brought to justice and be held accountable for this terrible outcome of poor choices. God will be the ultimate judge! Rest easy....JP

Vannessa K. Thomas

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 12/05/2009 07:34 PM

Case #: X77009

Location: 4106 N 40th Avenue

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

It’s been nearly 15 years since we have been able to enjoy your presence. How much we miss the laughter and ambition that always followed. Over the years she has missed birthdays, graduations and births. It is so different from always knowing that for every family gathering Vannessa would be there. Her dedication as a faithful mother surely makes her one of a kind. Her compassion and care for her mother was unmatched along with her fearless desire to be different. Even with so many memories to reflect on, so many others were snatched away when your young tender life was removed from this present age in 2009. Life has not been the same for any that knew Vannessa. Even Kayviaun, her oldest daughter, went from being an honor roll student to struggling to stay out of trouble. The impact and effect of the murder of Vannessa K. Thomas is detrimental. However, the most detrimental thing is that no one is being held accountable according to the letter of the law. Someone please help us get justice, bring some level of comfort, deliver some quality of rest to the family and loved ones of Vannessa Kay Thomas. WE

NEED JUSTICE! WE NEED YOU! If you know something, seen something, heard something, TELL SOMEOME!

Waw Gach

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 04/07/2020 09:38 PM

Case #: AP42006

Location: Benson Park at 7028 Military Avenue

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Waw Gach enjoyed being physically active. He loved track and field and wrestling.

Wesley V. Brayman Jr.

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 06/25/2018 08:09 AM

Case #: AK72844

Location: 5827 N 28th Avenue

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

Wesley was a father of five; three boys and two girls. He was a husband of eighteen years, a grandson, son, brother, cousin, uncle, nephew, and friend to so many. Wesley was caring , loving, and friendly. He was taken from us on June 25, 2018 while taking care of three of his children. Please, if you have any information as to who or what took place that day, it would be greatly appreciated in finding justice for him and his family. We love and miss him so much. He will never be forgotten and always in our hearts and on our minds.

Xavier Bass

Submit Tip View Details

Reward: Up to $25,000

Date: 11/05/2017 12:43 PM

Case #: AK13543

Location: Highway 75, Hamilton Street

Crime Type: Homicide

Crime Information:

"Death leaves a heartache no one can heal, love leaves a memory no one can steal". God be with the victims of violence directly or indirectly. God bless the Omaha Police Department, whatever they stand in need of. Thank you - Shalonda Bass and Family
